newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila car assemblers criticise excise tax plan.
newsitem.headline: Manila car assemblers criticise excise tax plan.

text.p: A group of Philippine car assemblers on Friday criticised a government plan to impose a 15 percent tax on Asian Utility Vehicles (AUVs).

"Imposing a new tax while the industry is in the process of being liberalised would place the industry in a very disadvantageous position," the Chamber of Automotive Manufacturers of the Philippines Inc (CAMPI) said.
AUVs are vehicles which can carry up to 15 passengers, usually used by small- and medium-sized entrepreneurs.
The government plans to impose a 15 percent excise tax to improve its revenue collection.

"The government, it seems, is more concerned with extracting whatever revenue it can generate from an industry which is already contributing substantially to government coffers," it added. -- Manila Newsroom (63 2) 841-8938 Fax 817-6267
